thread.title: Vandal may have damaged 'wrong car' in Aurora Aurora Beacon-News
thread.title_full: Vandal may have damaged 'wrong car' in Aurora - Aurora Beacon-News

author: Erika Wurst
title: Vandal may have damaged 'wrong car' in Aurora Aurora Beacon-News
text:
A vandal apparently damaged the wrong car early Wednesday morning in Aurora, and wanted the owner to know.
Aurora police said someone used yellow spray paint to write the phrase, "Sorry, wrong car," on the side of a damaged vehicle as it sat parked outside a home the 800 block of Oliver Avenue.
Two cars parked in the driveway of the home had their windows smashed out with a hammer, and both had been spray painted some time between 12:15 and 6 a.m., police said.
Police said phrases including, "I'm hungry," "I want a sandwich," and, "I smoke crack," were spray painted on both a Chrysler LeBaron and a Nissan Ultima, in addition to the "Sorry, wrong car," phrase.
According to the homeowner, the hammer used in the incident had been taken from an unlocked garage. When police found it, it was sticking out the back window of the Ultima.
The homeowner told police she has no idea who would have wanted to damage the vehicles.
Police are asking anyone with information to call investigators at 630-256-5500 or Crime Stoppers at 630-892-1000.
